STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 13, 2025
Felisha M Glutsch
ENNIS CENTER FOR CHILDREN - FLINT
1120 W Bristol Rd,
Flint, MI, 48507-5518
RE: License#: CB250201108
Dear Ms. Glutsch:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 2/10/2025 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (2) An agency shall complete written service
plans for each child and parent or parents, as
follows:
• (b) Within 120 calendar days after the
initial removal and at least once every 90
calendar days thereafter.
One of one independent living case records reviewed was late and passed the
120 calendar days required.

CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
• (5) An agency shall involve the child's parent or
parents and the foster parents in the
development of service plans to enable the
parent or parents and foster parents to
understand the plan for the child and the
parents' and the foster parent's role in assisting
the agency in carrying out the plan. An agency
shall give a copy to and review the parent-
agency treatment plan with the parent or parents
and foster parents. The agency must inform the
parent or parents and foster parent that the
information in the parent-agency treatment plan
and any other information about the child and
the child's family is confidential.
Five of eight foster care case records reviewed did not indicate that the plan was
developed with the parent/parents or foster parent’s to enable the
parent/parents/foster parent’s to understand the plan.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
• (1) An agency social service worker shall
complete a written adoptive evaluation within 90
days of the family signing an adoption
application and prior to approving a family for
adoption.
Two of six adoptive family evaluations were not completed within 90 days of
signing the application.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was not requested or required.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation 2023C0000584 was initiated on 8/4/2023, CAP approved on
9/11/2023, regarding an allegation that the foster parent left youth without
supervision. The agency was in violation with CPA Rule 12327 (5) (c). The agency
has no repeat violations with this rule during this reporting period.
The agency Interim inspection was completed on 2/28/2024 and the CAP was
approved on 3/4/2024. The agency was found in noncompliance with policy FOM
722-08D. There are no repeat violations during this reporting period.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator (CA) reported in an interview held onsite January 22,
2024, that the prior corrective action plan (CAP) was not implemented and
followed by staff, supervisors, or directors due to a high turnover during the past
year with foster care workers and supervisors. CA reported the building they were
occupying had issues and the agency had to relocate to a new location. It was
reported that reports were not accurately tracked which caused late signatures on
service plans.
The CA reported that the corrective action plan brought attention to areas that
needed oversight and improvement. The CAP provided supervisory guidelines to
improve compliance and tracking with departmental reports to assist with task
completion due dates and reminders. The CAP was provided to the staff with a
check and balance system put in place to ensure all metrics are met per policy,
and CPA rule regulations.

Financial Overview:
I reviewed the agency independent auditor’s report dated 9/30/2023, and
annual/budget financial report. There were no financial concerns identified.
Staff and Youth Interviews:
Three staff were interviewed onside on 1/22/2025. Staff reported feeling
supported by the agency. Staff reported supervisors and coworkers are available
to assist as needed. Staff did not report any safety concerns or areas of needs.
Description of Agency Walk Through:
The agency has adequate space and equipment to complete required
responsibilities. Files and CHRI are stored securely in a manner that prevent
unauthorized access within metal locked cabinets, drawers and behind locked
doors.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no Safety Alerts.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
2/13/2025
__________________________________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant

2/13/2025
